meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of immanentism.
meanings.sent1: The immanentistic philosophy focuses on the idea of divinity within the world.
meanings.sent2: She had an immanentistic view, believing that spiritual presence could be found in everyday life.
meanings.sent3: The immanentistic approach to spirituality made him see the beauty in the smallest details.
meanings.sent4: Her immanentistic perspective transformed the mundane into something magical.
meanings.sent5: The immanentistic nature of the forest filled her with a sense of wonder and awe.

meanings.definition: Believing in or emphasizing the presence of divinity within the world.
meanings.sent1: Their immanentistic faith taught them to see the sacred in all things.
meanings.sent2: The immanentistic belief system resonated with her spiritual journey.
meanings.sent3: His immanentistic outlook brought a sense of peace and harmony to his life.
meanings.sent4: The immanentistic perspective allowed her to feel connected to something greater.
meanings.sent5: The immanentistic presence of the sunset filled the sky with colors of divinity.
